Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time that the replicator waits after receiving an operation before sending back an acknowledgment. The default value is 5 milliseconds.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the checkpoint threshold. A checkpoint will be initiated when the log usage exceeds this value. Default value is 50. The unit is MB.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial size of the copy operation queue inside the replicator, which contains copy operations. Default value is 64. The value is the number of operations in the copy operation queue. Must be a power of 2.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<int> MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB
Public Property MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB : Nullable<int> with get, set
public: property Nullable<int> MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB { Nullable<int> get(); void set(Nullable<int> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the max size for an accumulated backup log across backups. An incremental backup requests will fail if the backup logs generated by the request causes the total amount of logs accumulated including the last full backup to be greater than MaxAccumulatedBackupLogSizeInMB. In such cases, user is required to take a full backup. Default value is 800. The unit is MB.
Docs.value: The max accumulated backup log size in MB.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the copy operation queue inside replicator, which contains copy operations. Default value is 1024. The value is the max number of operations in the copy operation queue. Must be a power of 2.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of extra persistent storage space reserved for the replicator specified in kilobytes that is associated with this replica. This value must be a multiple of 4. The default value is 4. The unit is KB.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the largest record size which the replicator may write specified in kilobytes for the log that is associated with this replica. This value must be a multiple of 4 and greater than or equal to 128. The default value is 1024. The unit is KB.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<int> MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB
Public Property MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB : Nullable<int> with get, set
public: property Nullable<int> MaxWriteQueueDepthInKB { Nullable<int> get(); void set(Nullable<int> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum write queue depth that the core logger can use as specified in kilobytes for the log that is associated with this replica. This value is the maximum number of bytes that can be outstanding during core logger updates. It may be 0 for the core logger to compute an appropriate value or a multiple of 4. The default value is 0. The unit is KB.

public: property Nullable<int> MinLogSizeInMB { Nullable<int> get(); void set(Nullable<int> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the minimum log size. A truncation will not be initiated if it would reduce the size of the log to below this value. Default value is 0.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<bool> OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage
Public Property OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage : Nullable<bool> with get, set
public: property Nullable<bool> OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage { Nullable<bool> get(); void set(Nullable<bool> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag, when true indicates the log should optimize in a way where less disk space is used for the log at the cost of IO performance. If false, the log will use more disk space but have better IO performance. Default value is true.
Docs.value: If the OptimizeLogForLowerDiskUsage option is enabled.

MemberSignature.Value: public string ReplicatorAddress { get; set; }
.property instance string ReplicatorAddress

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address in {ip}:{port} format that this replicator will use when communicating with other replicators. The default value is "localhost:0", which picks a dynamic port number in runtime. If replicator is running inside a container, you should try setting up and .

public: property Platform::String ^ ReplicatorListenAddress { Platform::String ^ get(); void set(Platform::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address in {ip}:{port} format that this replicator will use to receive information from other replicators. The default value is "localhost:0", which picks a dynamic port number in runtime. {ip} part of the listen address can be obtained from .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the address in {ip}:{port} format that this replicator will use to send information to other replicators. The default value is "localhost:0", which picks a dynamic port number in runtime. {ip} part of the publish address can be obtained from .

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<TimeSpan> RetryInterval { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.TimeSpan> RetryInterval
Public Property RetryInterval As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
member this.RetryInterval : Nullable<TimeSpan> with get, set
public: property Nullable<TimeSpan> RetryInterval { Nullable<TimeSpan> get(); void set(Nullable<TimeSpan> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets how long the replicator waits after it transmits a message from the primary to the secondary for the secondary to acknowledge that it has received the message. The default value is 5 seconds.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations
Public Property SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations : Nullable<bool> with get, set
public: property Nullable<bool> SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations { Nullable<bool> get(); void set(Nullable<bool> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag, when true indicates the secondary replicator should clear the in-memory queue after acknowledging the operations to the primary (After the operations are flushed to disk). Default value is false. Settings this to "TRUE" can result in additional disk reads on the new primary, while catching up replicas after a failover.
Docs.value: If the SecondaryClearAcknowledgedOperations option is enabled.

Docs.summary: Sets the interval after which the replicator sends a warning health report that the API is slow and is taking longer than expected duration. Default value is 5 minutes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the throttling threshold factor. Throttling will be initiated when the log usage exceeds this value times MinLogSizeInMB. Default value is 3.
